references.authors: Berg, J., Dickhaut, J., & McCabe, K.
references.title: Trust, Reciprocity, and Social History
references.relevance: Foundational - establishes Trust Game paradigm showing positive investments contradict rational predictions

references.authors: Bohnet, I., & Zeckhauser, R.
references.title: Trust, risk and betrayal
references.relevance: Introduces 'betrayal aversion' concept - differentiates trust from pure risk via MAPs

references.authors: Kahneman, D., & Tversky, A.
references.title: Prospect Theory: An Analysis of Decision under Risk
references.relevance: Central theoretical framework - provides base parameters (α, λ, γ) for modeling decisions

references.authors: Tversky, A., & Kahneman, D.
references.title: Advances in prospect theory: Cumulative representation of uncertainty
references.relevance: CPT extension with empirical parameter values (α≈0.88, γ≈0.61) used as baseline

references.authors: Eckel, C. C., & Wilson, R. K.
references.title: Is trust a risky decision?
references.relevance: Pioneering study finding null correlations between risk preferences and trust behavior

references.authors: Houser, D., Schunk, D., & Winter, J.
references.title: Distinguishing trust from risk: An anatomy of the investment game
references.relevance: Isolates risk assessment from prosocial motivations - shows trust/risk independence

references.authors: Fairley, K., Sanfey, A., Vyrastekova, J., & Weitzel, U.
references.title: Trust and risk revisited
references.relevance: Introduces Risky Trust Game (RTG) to standardize first-order risk in trust contexts

references.authors: Fairley, K., Vyrastekova, J., Weitzel, U., & Sanfey, A. G.
references.title: Subjective Beliefs About Trust and Reciprocity Activate an Expected Reward Signal in the Ventral Striatum
references.relevance: Shows differential ventral striatum activation between trust and risk despite behavioral similarities

references.authors: Aimone, J. A., Houser, D., & Weber, B.
references.title: Neural signatures of betrayal aversion: An fMRI study of trust
references.journal: Proceedings of the Royal Society B
references.relevance: Localizes betrayal aversion to right anterior insula - distinct neural signature from loss aversion

references.authors: Murphy, R. O., Ackermann, K. A., & Handgraaf, M. J. J.
references.title: Measuring Social Value Orientation
references.relevance: SVO measure used to quantify social preferences (φ) and validate the model

references.authors: Ashraf, N., Bohnet, I., & Piankov, N.
references.title: Decomposing trust and trustworthiness
references.relevance: Decomposes trust into unconditional kindness and reciprocity expectations - 62% variance explained

references.authors: Schechter, L.
references.title: Traditional trust measurement and the risk confound: An experiment in rural Paraguay
references.relevance: Finds positive trust-risk correlations with dice-betting paradigm - methodological contradictions

references.authors: Chetty, R., Hofmeyr, A., Kincaid, H., & Monroe, B.
references.title: The Trust Game Does Not (Only) Measure Trust: The Risk-Trust Confound Revisited
references.journal: Journal of Behavioral and Experimental Economics
references.relevance: Extensive elicitation (40 lotteries) shows 20% shared variance - measurement resolution matters

references.authors: Johnson, N. D., & Mislin, A. A.
references.title: Trust games: A meta-analysis
references.relevance: Meta-analysis of 162 replications - transfers ~50% endowments, reciprocity ~1/3

references.authors: Kanagaretnam, K., Mestelman, S., Shehata, M., & Nainar, K.
references.title: The Impact of Sex, Value Orientations and Risk Attitudes on Trust and Reciprocity
references.relevance: SVO significantly predicts trust (p=.002) but risk attitudes do not

references.authors: Nguyen, Q., Villeval, M. C., & Xu, H.
references.title: Trust under the Prospect Theory and Quasi-Hyperbolic Preferences
references.relevance: Only prior application of Prospect Theory to trust - limiting methodological asymmetry

references.authors: Stott, H. P.
references.title: Cumulative prospect theory's functional menagerie
references.relevance: Evaluation of 256 CPT variants - guides choice of value and weighting functions

references.authors: Lauharatanahirun, N., Christopoulos, G. I., & King-Casas, B.
references.title: Neural computations underlying social risk sensitivity
references.relevance: Behavioral trust-risk correlation (ρ=.60) but distinct neural mechanisms via amygdala

references.authors: Krain, A. L., Wilson, A. M., Arbuckle, R., et al.
references.title: Distinct neural mechanisms of risk and ambiguity: A meta-analysis of decision-making
references.relevance: Meta-analysis showing distinct neural networks for 1st vs 2nd order risk - explains confound

references.authors: Bohnet, I., Greig, F., Herrmann, B., & Zeckhauser, R.
references.title: Betrayal Aversion: Evidence from Brazil, China, Oman, Switzerland, Turkey, and the United States
references.relevance: Cross-cultural validation of betrayal aversion - universal τ parameter

references.authors: Cox, J. C.
references.title: How to identify trust and reciprocity
references.relevance: Method to separate trust and altruism via TG/Dictator Game comparison

references.authors: Tom, S. M., Fox, C. R., Trepel, C., & Poldrack, R. A.
references.title: The Neural Basis of Loss Aversion in Decision-Making Under Risk
references.relevance: Neural basis of loss aversion (λ) - striatal deactivation doubles activation for gains

references.authors: Hsu, M., Krajbich, I., Zhao, C., & Camerer, C. F.
references.title: Neural Response to Reward Anticipation under Risk Is Nonlinear in Probabilities
references.relevance: Nonlinear neural encoding of probabilities - validates inverse-S weighting function

references.authors: Imaizumi, Y., Tymula, A., Tsubo, Y., Matsumoto, M., & Yamada, H.
references.title: A neuronal prospect theory model in the brain reward circuitry
references.relevance: Unit recordings showing parametric integration in orbitofrontal cortex and striatum

references.authors: Cosmides, L., & Tooby, J.
references.title: Cognitive Adaptations for Social Exchange
references.relevance: Social contract theory - specialized cognitive mechanisms for detecting cooperation

references.authors: Coleman, J. S.
references.title: Foundations of Social Theory
references.relevance: Conceptualizes trust as rational calculation - predicts trust-risk correlations

references.authors: Evans, A. M., & Krueger, J. I.
references.title: Outcomes and expectations in dilemmas of trust
references.relevance: Proposes identical computational processes for social and non-social prospects

references.authors: Knight, F. H.
references.title: Risk, Uncertainty and Profit
references.relevance: Fundamental distinction between risk (known probabilities) vs uncertainty (unknown probabilities)

references.authors: Ellsberg, D.
references.title: Risk, Ambiguity, and the Savage Axioms
references.relevance: Establishes uncertainty taxonomy - ambiguity when neither outcomes nor probabilities known

references.authors: Knack, S., & Keefer, P.
references.title: Does Social Capital Have an Economic Payoff? A Cross-Country Investigation
references.relevance: 10% increase in societal trust = 0.5% higher annual economic growth

references.authors: Zak, P. J., & Knack, S.
references.title: Trust and Growth
references.relevance: Identifies causal pathway trust → growth via investment rate

references.authors: Brown, S., Gray, D., McHardy, J., & Taylor, K.
references.title: Employee trust and workplace performance
references.relevance: Trust enhances financial performance by reducing monitoring costs

references.authors: Zand, D. E.
references.title: Trust and Managerial Problem Solving
references.relevance: Definition of trust: willingness to increase vulnerability without control over others

references.authors: Glimcher, P. W.
references.title: Neuroeconomics: Decision Making and the Brain
references.relevance: Defines risk in neuroeconomics as variance over probability distribution of outcomes

references.authors: Keynes, J. M.
references.title: A Treatise on Probability
references.relevance: Early contribution to uncertainty taxonomy

references.authors: Karlan, D. S.
references.title: Using Experimental Economics to Measure Social Capital and Predict Financial Decisions
references.relevance: Trust behavior predicts real financial decisions - savings and default

references.authors: Fehr, E.
references.title: On the Economics and Biology of Trust
references.journal: Journal of the European Economic Association
references.relevance: SOEP risk willingness modestly predicts trust but betrayal aversion stronger

references.authors: Dohmen, T., Falk, A., Huffman, D., et al.
references.title: Individual Risk Attitudes: Measurement, Determinants, and Behavioral Consequences
references.journal: Journal of the European Economic Association
references.relevance: Validation of SOEP risk willingness measure

references.authors: Ben-Ner, A., & Halldorsson, F.
references.title: Trusting and trustworthiness: What are they, how to measure them, and what affects them
references.relevance: No relationship between behavioral and survey trust measures

references.authors: Etang, A., Fielding, D., & Knowles, S.
references.title: Does trust extend beyond the village? Experimental trust and social distance in Cameroon
references.relevance: Field evidence from Cameroon - non-significant trust-risk correlation (β=0.09, p>.05)

references.authors: Garapin, A., Muller, L., & Rahali, B.
references.title: Does Trust Mean Giving and not Risking? Experimental Evidence from the Trust Game
references.relevance: Within-subject design - social preferences predict but minimal variance (R²≈.14-.18)

references.authors: Breuer, W., Helduser, C., & Schade, P.
references.title: The More You Expect, the Less You Trust: On the Flipside of Trustworthiness Expectations
references.relevance: Higher trustworthiness expectations correlate with lower trust willingness - complex dynamics

references.authors: Derks, J., Lee, N. C., & Krabbendam, L.
references.title: Adolescent trust and trustworthiness: Role of gender and social value orientation
references.relevance: SVO predicts trust in adolescents (β=-0.31, p<.001)

references.authors: Wei, Z.
references.title: Trust and Social Value Orientation Study
references.relevance: Prosocials (M=0.62) trust more than proselfs (M=0.51, p<.001)

references.authors: Snijders, C. C. P.
references.title: Trust and commitments
references.relevance: Prosocial orientation correlates with trust propensity

references.authors: Lambert, B., Declerck, C. H., Emonds, G., & Boone, C.
references.title: Trust as commodity: Social value orientation affects the neural substrates of learning to cooperate
references.relevance: SVO modulates neural substrates of cooperative learning

references.authors: Liebrand, W. B. G.
references.title: The effect of social motives, communication and group size on behaviour in an N-person multi-stage mixed-motive game
references.relevance: Original Ring Measure for SVO - methodological foundation

references.authors: Trautmann, S. T., Vieider, F. M., & Wakker, P. P.
references.title: Causes of ambiguity aversion: Known versus unknown preferences
references.relevance: Social losses signal poor social judgment - additional dimensions

references.authors: Falk, A., & Fischbacher, U.
references.title: A theory of reciprocity
references.relevance: Theory of reciprocity including intentionality evaluations

references.authors: Ma, I., Sanfey, A. G., & Ma, W. J.
references.title: The social cost of gathering information for trust decisions
references.relevance: Reputation processing in trust decisions

references.authors: Kugler, T., Ye, B., Motro, D., & Noussair, C. N.
references.title: On Trust and Disgust: Evidence From Face Reading and Virtual Reality
references.relevance: Moral emotions in trust - additional mechanisms

references.authors: Schlösser, T., Mensching, O., Dunning, D., & Fetchenhauer, D.
references.title: Trust and Rationality: Shifting Normative Analyses of Risks Involving Other People Versus Nature
references.relevance: Norm adherence - distinguishes social vs natural risks

references.authors: Dunning, D., & Fetchenhauer, D.
references.title: Trust as an expressive rather than an instrumental act
references.relevance: Trust as expressive act - can exceed risk in certain contexts

references.authors: Kahneman, D., Knetsch, J. L., & Thaler, R. H.
references.title: Fairness and the Assumptions of Economics
references.relevance: Introduces Dictator Game - measures pure altruism

references.authors: Derks, J., Van Scheppingen, M. A., Lee, N. C., & Krabbendam, L.
references.title: Trust and mindreading in adolescents: The moderating role of social value orientation
references.relevance: SVO moderates relationship between theory of mind and trust

references.authors: Holt, C. A., & Laury, S. K.
references.title: Risk Aversion and Incentive Effects
references.relevance: Multiple price list for risk preference elicitation - standard method

references.authors: Zuckerman, M.
references.title: Sensation Seeking: Beyond the Optimal Level of Arousal
references.relevance: Sensation-seeking scale - measures individual differences

references.authors: Rogers, R. D., Lancaster, M., Wakeley, J., & Bhagwagar, Z.
references.title: Effects of beta-adrenoceptor blockade on components of human decision-making
references.relevance: β-adrenergic antagonists selectively reduce loss sensitivity

references.authors: Lichtenstein, S., & Slovic, P.
references.title: Reversals of preference between bids and choices in gambling decisions
references.relevance: Preference reversals - anomaly predicted by Prospect Theory

references.authors: Grether, D. M., & Plott, C. R.
references.title: Economic Theory of Choice and the Preference Reversal Phenomenon
references.relevance: Confirms preference reversals - violates standard theory

references.authors: Tversky, A., & Kahneman, D.
references.title: The Framing of Decisions and the Psychology of Choice
references.relevance: Framing effects - identical outcomes described as gains vs losses

references.authors: Kühberger, A.
references.title: The Influence of Framing on Risky Decisions: A Meta-analysis
references.journal: Organizational Behavior and Human Decision Processes
references.relevance: Meta-analysis of framing effects - general validity

references.authors: Booij, G. E.
references.title: The phonology of Dutch
references.relevance: Dutch phonotactic rules for creating non-social identifiers

references.authors: Hammond, M.
references.title: The Phonology of English: A Prosodic Optimality-theoretic Approach
references.relevance: English phonotactic rules for non-word validation

references.authors: Baayen, R H., Piepenbrock, R, & Gulikers, L.
references.title: CELEX2
references.relevance: Lexical database for verifying non-word status of identifiers

references.authors: Yarkoni, T., Balota, D., & Yap, M.
references.title: Moving beyond Coltheart's N: A new measure of orthographic similarity
references.relevance: OLD20 for measuring orthographic neighborhood density

references.authors: Rățală, C. E., Fallon, S. J., van der Schaaf, M. E., ter Huurne, N., Cools, R., & Sanfey, A. G.
references.title: Catecholaminergic modulation of trust decisions
references.relevance: Investigates the neurochemical modulation of trust, showing distinct mechanisms for social vs non-social risk.

categories.description: Essential papers for understanding trust-risk relationship

categories.description: Foundational studies on trust and the Trust Game paradigm
